DOC.brief_summary: The objective study determine effect different source form discretionary food dietary compensation energy intake healthy adult free living , real world set . Specifically , pilot study compare effect great caloric source savory sweeten discretionary food American diet ( savory snack v. sugar-sweetened beverage ) . The rationale conducting study test mechanism whereby sugar-sweetened beverage hypothesize relate weight gain obesity beyond discretionary food ( lack energy intake compensation due liquid form beverage ) , since evidence topic limit . The subject population 20 men woman age 18 59 overweight body mass index ( BMI ≥ 25 kg/m2 ) , generally healthy , consume sugar-sweetened beverage , willing incorporate sweeten beverage savory snack usual diet 4 week period .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Dietary Compensation Weight Gain Adults Savory Solid Sugary Liquid Discretionary Food Sources
DOC.detailed_description: The study design randomize parallel study consist 4-week period participant assign one two food group . Participants group provide daily provision choose sugar-sweetened beverage savory snack incorporate usual dietary pattern . The main outcome dietary intake , specifically energy intake gather 24 hour dietary recall . Secondary outcome include measure body weight / BMI . The participant blind main outcome affect result . To tell rationale study examine effect discretionary food source perceive health status provide standard , valid short questionnaire ( SF-12 ) beginning , middle end period . Investigators estimate energy intake necessary weight maintenance subject base upon standard approach equation account participant 's age , sex , body size , activity level . The subject provide approximately 15-20 % estimate daily energy need form sugar-sweetened beverage savory snack choice one period ask incorporate usual dietary pattern day 4 week . During 4 week period subject randomly prompt complete five , 24-hour dietary recall use online tool . They also ask fill short physical activity questionnaire intervention period short questionnaire perceive health ( SF-12 ) . They weight , height , waist circumference measure begin end period .
DOC.criteria: Healthy adult overweight ( BMI ≥ 25 kg/m2 ) consume sugarsweetened beverage savory snack willing consume amount beverage food provide supplement usual dietary habit study period Recently lose significant amount weight look lose weight recently begin new diet exercise regimen prevalent history major illness chronic disease ( e.g . diabetes , heart disease , cancer , metabolic disorder ) may affect adherence pregnant use prescription medication ( aside birth control ) report ≥ 1 alcoholic beverage day currently smoke report restrain eater < 51 % control selection preparation food eat adult lack capacity consent self
